author: Republic_Commando_Sev
title: Best Inika!
review:
Hewkii is the best Toa Inika! I love how his chain connects from his laser axe up to his back! I absolutly love the Zamor Spheres! they fly sooooo far! I love the armor and his mask is a cool color! It's like grey/silver! I would recamed this set to anyone!
Republic Commando Sev

author: CyandraZ
title: Best of the Inika!
review:
Toa Hewkii.

The Toa Inika brought many new changes to the standard Toa design, and were unlike any other canister sets before them, at the time at their release. Featuring light-up weapons, zamor launchers with rapid-fire ammo carriers, truly unique masks and armor, and an incredible height, the Inika are a sight to behold, both for better and for worse.

Toa Hewkii is one of the most unique Stone Toa ever, for obvious reasons. Besides being the first Stone Toa to carry a standard hand combat weapon (an axe), his color scheme is unlike any Stone canister kit before him. Doing away with the standard brown, Hewkii has orange-yellow joints (called Keetongu yellow in reference to the first Bionicle kit featuring the color) and gunmetal armor. Due to mediocre sales for the brown canister sets (compared to other colors), TLC has started to instead use keetongu yellow and colors like gray or black for stone kits. While this may be a major change, Hewkii looks striking and unique with it, and it sets him apart from the other stone Toa.

The Inika feature a boatload of new molds, with the only reused pieces (besides the standard Technic) being the arms, legs to body connector and Keetongu yellow joints. The shoulder and knee armor, legs, feet, head and front and back body pieces are all new. Also, there are two different feet and chest armor styles, each being in half of the Inika. The new armor pieces come in various colors, and they are quite good to use in MOC’s, as well as just looking plain cool. The back armor piece is more or less an unfinished Piraka body, and presents more uses than the former. The legs feature knee guards that, oddly, have large gaps in the middle. Still, they prevent unrealistic leg positions, so that’s cool. The feet are also cool, and I can see uses for them, although they are more difficult to use. Last and definitely least, the head is the worst of all the new pieces. Actually, it’s just a lime and white blob, with axle holes in the bottom. Originally, it was going to be glow in the dark, but now it is used to simulate the green eyes and white teeth in the Inika masks. Besides being practically useless in MOCs, this head is incompatible with all previous masks, and makes Inika mask incompatible with the old Toa heads. This in my opinion was a terrible move on TLC’s part, and I find it the most disappointing thing about the Inika.

Besides all the brand new Inika parts, Hewkii has 3 unique molds: his mask, axe, and a new chain link part. His mask, the Kanohi Sanok, is in my opinion one of the best stone Toa masks to date (ignoring the method of head connection). It truly looks like lumps of rock, while also being cool, and the gunmetal color is wonderful on it. As with most of the Inika weapons, Hewkii’s axe is not particularly interesting to me, and looks kind of weird. Still, the light-up feature is pretty cool, and looks awesome in the dark. Arguably, the most interesting mold is the new chain pieces. There’s a total of 11 in Hewkii, and they all connect solidly. Unlike the System chains, these pieces were made to fit in with Technic and Bionicle creations, thus they look very cool.

When built, Hewkii is very tall and poseable, as are all the Inika. His Zamor launcher is fairly cool looking, and works fairly well, but I know many dislike it. My answer: just take it off and replace it! It’s as simple as that.

Overall, Hewkii is the best of the Inika, along with Matoro, and should be your first Inika purchase if you get any. 5/5

author: Gus_263
title: My favorite Inika
review: My first and favorite Inika. He like very he others, but he include with good colors in the armor, and a   chain, that makes the weapon more cool than of other inika weapons. This set can be upgraded with some yellow, but no with very brown, my favorite color for toas. Another problem is the silver pieces. The sphere launcher addition don' like with the launcher, and the weapon with the armors. Overall, i rate it 5/5.

author: arc_trooper
title: Cool
review: Toa hewkii is one of the coolest toa inika.He carries an axe that lights up.He is also yellow and gray,which are different colors from the other stone toa.Also he carries a chain that is attached to the axe.Overall I am going to give Hewkii a 5 out of 5.

author: DarthVader_
title: Awesome Toa!
review: This is one of my favorite Toa Inika's!  I like his Zamor Sphere shooter and his other parts!  I like how he is the only one with a chain!  I wish he had the original brown color, but besides that, he is awesome!

author: BionicleBOOM
title: A little different Toa Inika
review:
Not saying that they weren't 'clones,' but Hewkii is a little different.  First of all the color, second of all his head is positioned a bit differently, to make it jut out a little further than the others (I know you're thinking get lost BIONICLE purist) and his kneepads are flipped so as to actually protect his knees.  Overall he looks a little better than the rest, and may be my favorite Toa Inika.

Pros:

-A little bit different

-Light-up sword

-Chain

-Multi-shot Zamor launcher

Cons:

-'Clone' of other Inika

author: Carl
title: BRONZE TOA!
review:
Toa Hewkii is really cool. He is my third favourite Toa Inika, only surpassed by Kongu and Nuparu.

Pros:

Bronze!
Yellow
Axe
Red Zamors
Zamor Launcher
Zamor Holder
Inika feet
Mask
Inika chest-plate
Chain

Cons:

Hard to distinguish facial features
Chain can get in the way

Toa Inika Hewkii is a great buy.

author: NickBrick
title: He is cool.But not worth the 18$ I paid
review:
For my birthday I got a amazon gift card. I decided to get an older bionicle. I got him for the Zamor spheres and the shooting thing. I guess I'll just skip to the pros and cons.

                                      Pros.
             Konohi Sanok the mask of accuracy.Bulky but that's what makes it cool
                             Yellow.For some reason I like Yellow Bionicles
            Zamor spheres and Zamor sphere shooter
                                   Light up axe.One of my favorite Bionicle weapons because its thick
              
                                           Cons.
                                              I paid so much moolah for it
                                                           pretty much the same build as new Bionicles.

          he's cool but get Hewkii cheaper than I did

author: KodakKid365
title: Hewkii is pretty nice.
review: Hewkii has really cool weapons. The gun is cool and gives you four bullets for it, which can all fit in at one time. The axe is big, has that cool chain thing, and glows red when you press the button.He has a cool color scheme and is just an overall cool set.

author: tkettle9719
title: The Scoundrel Toa
review:
I got this set for myself at Target many years ago, and think that this is a good Toa, but it definitely isn't as great as Nuparu or Jaller.

Pros

  • -The mask, though looking a bit aged, is an interesting piece.
  • -The combo of gray and yellow-orange is nice, also.
  • …

Cons

  • -Red strobe light just looks wrong.
  • -The mask skeletal piece is greatly discolored on mine, makes him look like he has green teeth (EWWWWWW!).
  • …

This is a good set by all means, but it looks a bit weird in my opinion. I recommend this, but the aforementioned two are much better.
